revised_title: Four Generations of Nuclear Physicists and the Evolution of Nuclear Physics
tldr: This article discusses the development of nuclear physics through four generations of physicists, from Rutherford and Bohr to the young physicists of the 20th century. It highlights the progress of research, advancements in research apparatus, the evolution of research organization, and the relationship between nuclear physics and industrial societies. The article also touches upon the challenges and future directions in the field, including the discovery of new particles, the search for the structure of the electron, and the graininess of the proton.
